definition: rifle (loanword)/also written 來復槍|来复枪
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: The local farmers have armed themselves with rifles and pistols.
sentences.chinese: 當地農夫以來福槍及手槍來武裝自己。

sentences.english: He himself rode out two rifle-shot lengths down the hill to meet us.
sentences.chinese: 他自己出兩個輪子來福槍開槍長度山上下來迎接我們。

sentences.english: He went hunting with a rifle.
A police officer's rifle rests on the front seat.
sentences.chinese: 一名警察的來福槍靠在前面的座椅上。

sentences.english: He carried a rifle in his right hand.
sentences.chinese: 他右手提著一把來福槍。

sentences.english: I made a drawing of myself crouched over a rifle, blowing out my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我畫了一副自己蹲在來福槍上，射爆心臟的畫。

sentences.english: This old and rusty rifle is a dead shot.
sentences.chinese: 正是這隻老舊的來福槍命中了那致命的一槍。

sentences.english: It is illegal to possess rifles in some states.
sentences.chinese: 在一些州持有來福槍是違法的。

sentences.english: I saw flashes of the rifles and heard the reports.
sentences.chinese: 我看見了來福槍的閃光，然後是爆炸聲。

sentences.english: IT WAS so cold that rifles jammed and blood froze in men's wounds.
sentences.chinese: 來福槍冷到卡殼，傷口的血液冷到凍結。

sentences.english: He rested his rifle against the wall.
